Overview.Summary: The 2018 Armenian presidential election resulted in the election of former president Serzh Sargsyan as prime minister (6,7). This sparked protests and demands for snap elections (8,9). However, Sargsyan resigned amidst the protests, leading to the election of Armen Sarkissian as president (1,10). Overview.Summary: The 2018 Armenian presidential election resulted in the election of Armen Sarkissian as president (1,5). The election marked a shift towards a parliamentary system of government, with the president now being elected by parliament (5). Protests erupted against former president Serzh Sargsyan, who had served two consecutive terms as president and was unable to seek re-election (6,9). Talks between the government and opposition parties to address the situation collapsed (7). Depi Evratesil, the Armenian selection for Eurovision 2018, featured 20 songs (8).

Timeline.Text: Potential presidential candidate Armen Sarkissian presents cooperation agreement between Armenia and Kazakhstan.

Overview.Summary: The 2018 Armenian presidential election resulted in the victory of Serzh Sargsyan (1), who congratulated Egyptian President Abdel Fatah al-Sisi on his victory (1). The election took place on April 2, 2018 (1). It was also noted that the former military commander secured 97% of the votes in the previous election (4). However, protests erupted in the country and the prime minister at the time, Serzh Sargsyan, was forced to resign (5). The opposition leader, Nikol Pashinian, is now working towards reforming the country (6). The new president, Armen Sarkissian, was chosen by parliament on March 2, 2018 (7). The presidential election in Finland also took place in 2018, on January 28 (9). Sauli Niinistö won the election with 62.59% of the vote, ending 30 years of social democratic dominance (8). The OSCE observed the election and undertook a Needs Assessment Mission from October 24 to 27, 2017 (9). A candidate analysis was also conducted, examining various background variables such as degree of urbanization and income level (10).

Timeline.Text: The first round of the 2018 Finnish presidential election takes place, with Sauli Niinistö winning 62.59% of the vote.
Sauli Niinistö is inaugurated as the President of Finland for his second term.
The candidate analysis of the 2018 Finnish presidential election is released, showing the impact of various background variables on the candidates' results.
Presidential elections are held in Finland every six years.
Armen Sarkissian is elected as the new President of Armenia by the country's parliament.
President Serzh Sargsyan of Armenia congratulates Abdel Fatah al-Sisi on his victory in the 2018 Egyptian presidential election.
Serzh Sargsyan resigns as the Prime Minister of Armenia following mass demonstrations in the streets of the capital.
Nikol Pashinian, the leader of the opposition protest movement in Armenia, expresses his desire to reform the country.
The results of the 2018 Iraqi parliamentary election are manually recounted following allegations of fraud.
A storage site in Baghdad housing roughly half of the ballots from the 2018 Iraqi parliamentary election catches fire, damaging the ballots.

Overview.Summary: Armen Sarkissian was elected as the 4th president of Armenia (1,3,7,10). He was the only candidate on the ballot and was endorsed by the ruling Republican Party of Armenia (1). He was sworn into office by placing his right hand on the original book of the Constitution of Armenia and a 7th century Bible (3). Sarkissian had previously asked for time to hold meetings with different political forces, the leadership of Artsakh, business and community leaders before giving consent to becoming the ruling party's candidate (5,8). President of Iran, Hassan Rouhani, congratulated Sarkissian on his election and expressed hopes for the expansion of bilateral ties (6). He succeeds Serzh Sarksyan, who opposition leaders say could become prime minister and continue to wield power (4,9).

Overview.Summary: The 2018 Armenian presidential election saw Armen Sarkissian elected as the country's new president (2,3,7,12). This transition to a parliamentary system of government was praised by the ruling coalition (15). The election was conducted by the National Election Authority, which was established in 2017 (12). However, there was controversy over the actions taken by the Egyptian government to suppress critical election monitoring efforts (17). In contrast, the voting percentage for Finnish citizens living in Finland was 69.9% (13). The incumbent president, Vladimir Putin, won the 2024 Russian presidential election with 88% of the vote (19).

Timeline.Text: The National Electoral Authority announces the dates for the 2018 Egyptian presidential election.
Armen Sarkissian is elected as the 4th President of Armenia by the Armenian Parliament.
The International Foundation for Electoral Systems (IFES) provides information on the 2018 Egyptian presidential election.
Transparency International denounces the actions taken by the Egyptian government to suppress critical election monitoring efforts.
Egyptians begin voting for their next president, with incumbent President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Moussa Moustafa Moussa as the only two candidates.
The results of the first round of the Egyptian presidential election are announced, with President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared the winner.
Serzh Sargsyan, former President of Armenia, offers Armen Sarkissian the ruling Republican Party's nomination for the 2018 Armenian presidential election.
The 2018 Armenian Revolution takes place, leading to the resignation of Prime Minister Serzh Sargsyan.
Former President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan resigns amid ongoing protests.
The 2023 Czech presidential election takes place, with Petr Pavel winning.
The 2024 Russian presidential election is held, with Vladimir Putin winning a fifth term.
Parliamentary elections take place in Iraq, with the Council of Representatives electing the Iraqi president and prime minister.
